summary: The "Cook Islands" refer to a self-governing territory in free association with New Zealand, situated in the South Pacific. In the context of EU legal and regulatory frameworks, the Cook Islands may be relevant for discussions on economic geography, particularly concerning trade agreements, development aid, and environmental regulations. The EU's engagement with the Cook Islands can influence regional economic stability and compliance with international standards. As a jurisdiction, the Cook Islands may also be examined in relation to issues of tax regulation and financial transparency, which are pertinent to EU policies aimed at combating tax evasion and promoting fair economic practices.
